intro: Hydrobryum griffithii var. floribundum, commonly known as the Kashmir marsh plant, is a species of flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with elongated leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear pale green to white flowers, which bloom during the summer months. It thrives in moist, nutrient-poor soils and is often found in wetlands and mountain meadows. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
